This meal becomes your big domino for calmer energy and steadier strands.

Step-by-step implementation

  1. Plan tonight: Before bed, decide tomorrowâ€™s breakfastâ€”fast options work fine: Greek yogurt + fruit, or tofu scramble with vegetables.
  2. Hit 25â€“30â€¯g protein: Combine any of these: 2 eggs + smoked salmon, or a vegan smoothie with pea protein, chia, and berries.

week3.practice2_html:
What it is

Joelma, youâ€™re in the peak phase â€” shedding feels unrelenting after your July surgery, but this is your pivot point. Right now, your follicles are alive yet low on raw materials, especially protein since you usually hit that in only one meal. This weekâ€™s focus becomes your â€œbig dominoâ€ â€” fueling every cell so your scalp can shift from survival mode toward stabilization before spring rolls around.

Step-by-step implementation

  2. Add color at every plate. Include two different colored vegetables or fruits each day to load antioxidants that calm postâ€‘surgery inflammation.

week3.practice3_html:
What it is

Calm Your Scalp and Body is a grounding miniâ€‘ritual to quiet your nerves when anxiety spikes, so your body can shift from â€œfight or flightâ€ back into repair and hair growth mode.

Why this practice matters for you now

Right now, Joelma, youâ€™re in the peak phase â€” shedding feels loud but follicles are still alive. After surgery and hormonal changes, your stress axis is hypersensitive. Each calm reset you create sends the message, â€œweâ€™re safe now,â€ helping you move toward stabilization. This is your big domino: steadying your nervous system will speed the turn from shedding to regrowth by spring. ğŸŒ±

Step-by-step implementation

  1. Pause the spiral. When panic hits about shedding, place a hand over your scalp and breathe out longer than you breathe in â€” four seconds in, six out â€” repeat 5 rounds.
  2. Ground your body. Feel your feet connect to the floor or your seat to the chair. Name one thing you can see, one you can feel, and one you can hear. This anchors you in the present.
  3. Relax your scalp. Using fingertips, sweep small circles from front to crown for one minute, not digging in, just warming the skin.
  4. Move the energy. Take a slow 5â€‘minute walk or stretch â€” you already use exercise to cope, so let movement finish the stress cycle.
  5. Close with gratitude. Say quietly, â€œMy body is healing.â€ This tiny phrase retrains your brain each time.

What to look for

  • Early wins: sleeping more deeply within a week, shorter stress flareâ€‘ups when you notice shedding, and scalp tension easing.
  • Watch-outs: if rumination loops at night, avoid scrolling in bed; swap for breathing or gentle massage before lights out.
  • Consistency builds momentum â€” one calm breath at a time, love. ğŸŒ¿

week3.week_summary_html:
